instruction: [INST] Analyze this file to learn MacBook motherboard repair. The 'definitions' section explains key technical terms. The 'threads' section contains real-world repair discussions. Use both sections to understand and learn how to troubleshoot MacBook issues. Posts from username 'larossmann' , 'dukefawks' , and '2informaticos' are posts from trusted experts.[/INST]

definitions.A1286: What is A1286? A1286 is a model number for a 15 inch size MacBook Pro Unibody from years Late 2008, Mid 2009, Mid 2009 , Mid 2010, Early 2011, Late 2011, Mid 2012 with EMC 2255, that may contain one of these boards depending on the year & configuration: 820-2330, 820-2532, 820-2523, 820-2533, 820-2850, 820-2915, 820-3330..
definitions.820-2915: What is 820-2915? a LOGIC BOARD PART NUMBER.
definitions.PPBUS_G3H: What is PPBUS_G3H? Main system power rail that charges the battery, or is power from the battery, that everything else is powered from. .
definitions.PP3V3_S5: What is PP3V3_S5? PP3V3_S5 is a 3.3v power rail when the system is in an S5 soft off power state.
definitions.PP5V_S0: What is PP5V_S0? PP5V_S0 is a 5v power rail present when the system is in an S0 working state..
definitions.PP1V05_S0:
What is PP1V05_S0? The PP1V05_S0 power rail is for various components on the logic board that require a 1.05V supply voltage in the S0 (on) state. This voltage rail is likely to be used by the CPU (for VCCIO), PCH (Platform Controller Hub).

.
definitions.PP3V4_G3H: What is PP3V4_G3H? This is a typo of PP3V3_G3H When you see PP3V4_G3H, assume they meant to type PP3V3_G3H.

threads.title: <MACBOOK MODEL NUMBER>A1286</MACBOOK MODEL NUMBER> <LOGIC BOARD PART NUMBER>820-2915</LOGIC BOARD PART NUMBER>-b green light, fans try to spin.
threads.message:
Macbook pro <MACBOOK MODEL NUMBER>A1286</MACBOOK MODEL NUMBER> <LOGIC BOARD PART NUMBER>820-2915</LOGIC BOARD PART NUMBER>-b
history
this is my personal macbook. I dont use it for gaming or graphic rendering.

I have reflowed the GPU twice as it has died. I'm aware reflowing is not a permanent fix. It's a bad bandaid.

anyway.. I reflowed it today, and now it won't boot.

problem..
when I plug in the mag, it's the genuine 85w mag, the light remains green.
and upon plugging the mag in the fans try and spins, like jerking every 1 to 2 seconds.

I have checked rails

<SIGNAL>PPBUS_G3H</SIGNAL> is good
<SIGNAL>PP3V4_G3H</SIGNAL> is good
<SIGNAL>PP5V_S0</SIGNAL> is not there
<SIGNAL>PP1V05_S0</SIGNAL> is not there and its shorted.
on <SIGNAL>PP3V3_S5</SIGNAL> I'm getting 2.707v unstable, moving from 2.703 to 2.762 correct me if I'm wrong. But should that be 0v when the mac ain't on ?

threads.title: <MACBOOK MODEL NUMBER>A1286</MACBOOK MODEL NUMBER> <LOGIC BOARD PART NUMBER>820-2915</LOGIC BOARD PART NUMBER>-b green light, fans try to spin.
threads.message:
<SIGNAL>PP3V3_S5</SIGNAL> should appear when charger is connected.
No need to press power button, as the machine should start by itself.

"<SIGNAL>PP1V05_S0</SIGNAL> is not there and its shorted."
Exact value?
There is low value as normal...

I suppose you damaged the GPU, or CPU with too much heat.
Resistance to ground on GPU power rail?
